result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Grant A Zerfass in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Grant A Zerfass.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Discovery received, Offer sent in May 2022. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defense letter to Judge re: rescheduling

9/14/22 Court's response: This remains on, The next hearing is over a month away. This is a child abuse case with a duty to expedite. We have already delayed this for the motion that was withdrawn. the defendant has plenty of time to arrange a ride. Case needs resolution or trial. PAK

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Grant A Zerfass in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Grant A Zerfass. Called @ 1:32 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment. Record by Atty. Pruden who waives further reading of the Information and enters not guilty pleas on behalf of his client. Matter set for status hearing.
Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:13 PM - Grant A. Zerfass in court. Attorney Larry Pruden in court for and with Grant Zerfass. ADA TenHaken in court for the State.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting two weeks for an Arraignment Hearing.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Larry Pruden

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Grant A Zerfass appeared in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Grant Allen Zerfass appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Mackenzie Renner for bond purposes only. Victim present in court and asking for no violent contact. Victim enforced 72 hour no contact. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
